intro: Blepharipappus carnosus, commonly known as the hairy leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance, and its flowers are usually yellow or white. The plant is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in low-nutrient soils.
